duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist the Community Manager in the successful site management of the apartment community, providing leadership, guidance, and motivation to ensure a positive working environment and quality community living.
Administer the day-to-day leasing office operations and oversee all computer input of the apartment community.
Direct the leasing staff and work with the Community Manager to recommend marketing and leasing strategies to meet the goals of Shea Properties.
Review and approve move-out statements, ensuring compliance with state law and company policies.
Coordinate with Leasing and Maintenance staff to schedule move-ins and ensure all apartments are inspected prior to move-in.
Manage resident and vendor files, ensuring completeness and accuracy of all paperwork and documentation.
Prepare and deliver all legal and formal notices in accordance with state law and company policy.
Maintain all account records and transactions, preparing reports in an accurate and timely manner.
Direct the functions of the leasing office, supervise the leasing staff’s daily activities, and prepare all leasing paperwork and documents.
Participate in the staff selection process, recruit, hire, and train leasing staff under the approval and direction of the Community Manager.
Prepare annual reviews for all direct reports, set goals and objectives, and implement Professional Development Plans for all associates.
Oversee and/or conduct weekly sales “leasing fundamentals” meetings and support industry networking.
Perform other duties as assigned, including handling on-call duties as directed by supervisor.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent (Some college level courses preferred)
